item.title: China Appears to Have Repatriated North Koreans Despite International Pressure
item.description: Hundreds are believed to have been forcibly sent back to the Kim Jong Un regime, where they likely face imprisonment and abuse, experts say.

item.title: Sartorius Cuts 2023 Guidance
item.description: Sartorius shares plunged after it downgraded its 2023 outlook, now expecting sales to fall around 17%, and after it reported lower preliminary figures for sales and earnings in the first nine months.

item.title: Oil Inches Higher On Concerns Middle East Tensions Could Escalate
item.description: Oil furures rose close to 2% as worries mount that the conflict in Israel and Gaza could spill over into the wider region.

item.title: Bond-Market Volatility Likely to Persist in Coming Weeks
item.description: Bond-market volatility is expected to remain in the coming weeks as investors digest the latest economic data and try to gauge monetary-policy direction, Generali Insurance Asset Management said.

item.title: Singapore Central Bank Keeps Monetary Policy Unchanged
item.description: The Monetary Authority of Singapore left its monetary policy unchanged in a widely expected move.

item.title: Microsoft's Activision Deal Gets U.K. Green Light
item.description: Microsoft’s acquisition of Activision Blizzard won approval from the U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority, clearing a path for the companies to close the $75 billion deal after a lengthy struggle with regulators.

item.title: Microsoft's Activision Deal Gets Green Light From U.K. Regulator
item.description: The decision clears a path for the companies to close the $75 billion deal after a lengthy struggle with regulators.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 0.5%, Dragged by Tech, Pharma Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended broadly lower, dragged by sharp falls in tech and pharmaceutical stocks, as concerns about the scope of the Fed’s tightening resurfaced.

item.title: Metals Mixed as Investors Remain Uncertain
item.description: Base metals were mixed, with gold higher and as Metals Week draws to a close, analysts said the market outlook remained uncertain.

item.title: Hamas Attack on Israel Defies Efforts to Neutralize Iran
item.description: The invasion by the Palestinian militants with the help of Iran revealed Tehran’s resurgent influence in the Middle East.

item.title: China's Teetering Local Debt Mountain, in Six Charts
item.description: After a decade of kicking the can down the road, the problem has become impossible to ignore. Beijing might soon have no choice but to bail out cities and provinces.

item.title: The Fed Is Putting Too Much Faith in Markets
item.description: The Fed has a new theory—the bond market is doing its job for it, so it can sit back rather than raise rates again this year—but the theory deserves a closer look.

item.title: South Korea Had High Hopes for 5G. What Happened?
item.description: Things didn’t work out as expected, thanks in part to technical problems and a lack of consumer demand

item.title: Israel Tells 1.1 Million Civilians to Evacuate Northern Gaza
item.description: The U.N. asks the Israeli military to reconsider the order, warning of devastating humanitarian consequences.

item.title: Japan Seeks to Dissolve Moon Church After Pleas of Shinzo Abe Assassination Suspect
item.description: The government says the former Unification Church caused “immense suffering,” echoing the accused killer’s complaints.

item.title: Israel Tells 1.1 Million Civilians to Evacuate Northern Gaza
The FDA banned the sale of Vuse Alto menthol e-cigarettes, sold by Reynolds American, which have surpassed Juul as the top-selling vaping products in the U.S.
item.description: The FDA banned the sale of Vuse Alto menthol e-cigarettes, sold by Reynolds American, which have surpassed Juul as the top-selling vaping products in the U.S.

item.title: Social Security's cost-of-living adjustment will be 3.2% in 2024, after bigger increases in the past two years, bringing the average monthly check for retirees' to $1,906.
item.description: Social Security’s cost-of-living adjustment will be 3.2% in 2024, after bigger increases in the past two years, bringing the average monthly check for retirees’ to $1,906.

item.title: Hamas militants who flooded into southern Israel from Gaza last weekend carried detailed maps of the towns and military bases that they targeted.
item.description: Hamas militants who flooded into southern Israel from Gaza last weekend carried detailed maps of the towns and military bases that they targeted.

item.title: Former Barclays chief Jes Staley was fined more than $2 million and banned from senior banking roles by U.K. regulators, who said he misled themabout his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
item.description: Former Barclays chief Jes Staley was fined more than $2 million and banned from senior banking roles by U.K. regulators, who said he misled them about his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
